main event: The observer, a radar technician, reported seeing a large, bright, oval-shaped object approximately 75 feet in diameter that was traveling at a tremendous rate of speed from east to west at an estimated altitude of 2,000 feet near Marshall, Michigan on February 8, 1964.
interesting points: The object was very bright and seemed to be illuminated from within.
The object was traveling much faster than any conventional aircraft the observer had seen before.
The object suddenly disappeared into the darkness after being observed for approximately 30 seconds.
The observer is a radar technician and has observed many aircraft, but has never seen anything like this object before.
The observer requested any information the Air Force could provide concerning this incident.
